title.native: 超時空騎団サザンクロス

description:
By the year 2120, humans have successfully colonized other planets following the near devestation of Earth from the last great world war. However, on Gloire, one such colony are surprised and unprepared at the arrival of The Zor, a group of beings whom were the original inhabitants of the planet and left following similar near fatal events. Coming to reclaim their former home world, a relentless war erupts between both races that ultimately leads to a cataclysmic showdown and into a no-win scenario for either.

(Source: Anime News Network)

name.native: ジャンヌ・フランセーズ
サイフリート・ヴァイス

node.description:
Hironobu Kageyama is a Japanese musical artist prominent in the soundtracks for anime, video game, and tokusatsu productions. He is sometimes called Kami by his fans. Kageyama got his big break at age 16, as lead singer of the pop group LAZY. By the early '80s, the band split and Kageyama went solo. He found major success once he started to sing the theme songs of anime and tokusatsu shows. Becoming immensely popular soon after, Kageyama went on to be dubbed the "Prince of Anime/Tokusatsu Songs" and is a main fixture for shows to this day. He also got the nickname "Mr. DBZ" by fans of Dragon Ball Z as he did the most songs for that anime. He is an original member and the current leader of the popular vocal group JAM Project. Also, along with Masaaki Endoh, he hosts "Anipara Ongakukan", a TV show that aired at Kids Station. One of the few voice acting roles he performed was Zaruba of the tokusatsu series GARO.

[Website](http://www.airblanca.com/)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/湖川友謙)

Most known for his work in the '80s with [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

Often goes by one of his many pen-names.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/北爪宏幸)

His representative works include [Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ](https://anilist.co/anime/86/), [Char's Counterattack](https://anilist.co/anime/87/) and [Moldiver](https://anilist.co/anime/571/).

Retired from the anime industry in the early 2000s and has since worked on manga.

Toriumi Jinzou was a Japanese screenwriter who first began his career during the "revolutionary era" of Japanese animation on Mach Go Go Go (Speed Racer), Science Ninja Team Gatchaman (Battle of the Planets/G-Force) and Yatterman.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/寺田憲史)

Terada's more notable works include writing the first three games of the Final Fantasy series. He also worked on Batman: Dark Tomorrow, created the concept for the Sega CD game Dark Wizard, and was the main script writer for the [Kimagure Orange Road](https://anilist.co/anime/1087/) series among other things.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/寺田憲史)

Terada's more notable works include writing the first three games of the Final Fantasy series. He also worked on Batman: Dark Tomorrow, created the concept for the Sega CD game Dark Wizard, and was the main script writer for the [Kimagure Orange Road](https://anilist.co/anime/1087/) series among other things.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤健_(作曲家%29) (Not to be confused with the [other composer](https://anilist.co/staff/365702/))
